metadata.title: CVE-2017-14492 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in dnsmasq before 2.78 allows remote attackersto cause a denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary code via acrafted IPv6 router advertisement request.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14492` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dnsmasq - 2.68-1ubuntu0.2
dnsmasq-base - 2.68-1ubuntu0.2
dnsmasq-utils - 2.68-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dnsmasq package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.68-1ubuntu0.2').
